pull.title: Fix typos
pull.body: Fix some typos not covered by #10705.

events.body:
Search and fix:
 - targetting;
 - parametres
 - discardability (?)
Added corrections for three misspellings of the word "transaction" :-)

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -46,7 +46,7 @@ linearize-hashes.py.
 (Default: `1000*1000*1000 bytes`)
 * `netmagic`: Network magic number.
 * `out_of_order_cache_sz`: If out-of-order blocks are being read, the block can
-be written to a cache so that the blockchain doesn't have to be seeked again.
comments.body: I would keep this as-is, since "seek" has a technical meaning (referring to the system call of the same name). It's not necessarily grammatical English, but I'd consider it grammatical programmer-English.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -46,7 +46,7 @@ linearize-hashes.py.
 (Default: `1000*1000*1000 bytes`)
 * `netmagic`: Network magic number.
 * `out_of_order_cache_sz`: If out-of-order blocks are being read, the block can
-be written to a cache so that the blockchain doesn't have to be seeked again.
comments.body: Sure, but is the documentation referring to the system call in this specific case?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -46,7 +46,7 @@ linearize-hashes.py.
 (Default: `1000*1000*1000 bytes`)
 * `netmagic`: Network magic number.
 * `out_of_order_cache_sz`: If out-of-order blocks are being read, the block can
-be written to a cache so that the blockchain doesn't have to be seeked again.
comments.body: how about "...so that we don't need to seek through the blockchain again"?
